example: You can borrow it as long as you return it tomorrow.
tr: Yarın geri getirmen şartıyla ödünç alabilirsin.

example: He talks as if he knows everything.
I’m about to start the meeting.
It’s likely to rain this evening.
They are proud of their team.
Did you make this cake by yourself?
tr: Bu keki tek başına mı yaptın?

example: Let’s have coffee and catch up soon.
We need to check in two hours before the flight.
tr: Uçuştan iki saat önce check-in yapmalıyız.

example: Can you check on the kids?
I came across an old photo.
You can count on me.
I’m cutting down on sugar.
We need to deal with this problem now.
She smiled even though she was tired.
He fell asleep during the movie.
We must figure out a solution.
Please fill out this form.
First of all, thank you for coming.
tr: Her şeyden önce geldiğiniz için teşekkürler.

example: You’ll get used to the new schedule.
We are going through a difficult time.
Book tickets in advance.
Call this number in case of emergency.
They went hiking in spite of the rain.
Look up the word in a dictionary.
Call me no matter what happens.
On average, the train is on time.
It’s cheap; on the other hand, it’s slow.
Did you pay for the tickets?
Don’t put off your homework.
I ran into an old friend yesterday.
We set off early to avoid traffic.
tr: Trafikten kaçınmak için erken yola çıktık.

example: Sooner or later, you’ll need to decide.
tr: Er ya da geç karar vermen gerekecek.

example: Let’s stay in touch after graduation.
Take advantage of the free trial.
Take notes during the lecture.
She turned down the job offer.
What if we miss the bus?
I’m going whether or not it rains.
I’m working on a new project.
